Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
Launcher.Simulator
public class Simulator extends Object
Simulator coordinates external node processes and collects events.

The Simulator launches external Java processes for each node (entrances, crossroads and exits), starts an EventHandler that reads events into a priority queue and exposes that queue to callers. It also provides lifecycle control methods to start, stop and request a graceful stop of entrance processes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulator

      public Simulator()
      Create a new Simulator instance.

      The constructor initializes internal maps and determines the platform java executable path used to spawn node processes.

  • Method Details

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Start the simulation.

      This method starts the internal EventHandler to collect events, launches external processes for each configured node and waits briefly for initialization. If the simulator is already running the call is a no-op.

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stop the simulation immediately.

      This stops all node processes, stops the event handler and marks the simulator as not running.

    • stopEntranceProcesses

      public void stopEntranceProcesses()
      Request a graceful stop of entrance processes only.

      This is used when the simulator should stop accepting new vehicles but allow existing traffic to finish. The method attempts to stop all entrance processes and waits briefly for termination.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Return whether the simulator is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if running, false otherwise

    • getEventQueue

      public PriorityBlockingQueue<Event> getEventQueue()
      Return the simulator's event queue.
      Returns:
      a priority blocking queue of Event
